io.afero.sdk.client.retrofit2

Class AferoClientRetrofit2

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.afero.sdk.client.retrofit2.AferoClientRetrofit2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AferoClient

    public class AferoClientRetrofit2
extends Object
implements AferoClient
    Concrete implementation of AferoClient that provides access to the Afero Cloud API.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • setOwnerAndActiveAccountId

        public void setOwnerAndActiveAccountId(String accountId)
        Sets both the owner and currently active account IDs of the currently authenticated account. The active account ID is used in all subsequent Afero Cloud API calls that require an account ID.
        Parameters:
        accountId - ID of the authenticated Afero account returned from usersMe()

      • getOwnerAccountId

        public String getOwnerAccountId()
        Gets the owner account ID of the currently authenticated Afero account. This ID will have been typically the one returned from usersMe()
        Returns:
        ID of an authenticated Afero account

      • setActiveAccountId

        public void setActiveAccountId(String accountId)
        The account ID to be used in subsequent Afero Cloud API calls that require an account ID. This can be either the owner account returned by usersMe() or a shared account returned from the Afero Cloud API (accounts/{accountId}/accountUserSummary).
        Parameters:
        accountId - ID of an authenticated Afero account

      • getActiveAccountId

        public String getActiveAccountId()
        Specified by:
        getActiveAccountId in interface AferoClient
        Returns:
        ID previously set by setActiveAccountId(java.lang.String) or setOwnerAndActiveAccountId(java.lang.String)

      • isOwnerAccountActive

        public boolean isOwnerAccountActive()
        Returns:
        true if the owner account is also the currently active one

      • clearAccount

        public void clearAccount()
        Clears both the owner account and the active account. Typically done on user signout.

      • observeActiveAccount

        public Observable<String> observeActiveAccount()
        Observes active account changes triggered by calls to setActiveAccountId(String).

        Example: 

        
     aferoClient.observeActiveAccount().subscribe(new Action1<String>() {
         @Override
         public void call(String accountId) {
              // new accountId has been set
         });

        Returns:
        Observable that emits the new account ID in Observer.onNext(T).

      • getAccessToken

        public Observable<AccessToken> getAccessToken(String user,
                                              String password)
        Initiates OAuth2 authentication with the specified user and password.

        Example: 

        
     aferoClient.getAccessToken(userId, password, AferoClientRetrofit2.GRANT_TYPE_PASSWORD)
         .subscribe(new Observer<AccessToken>() {
              @Override
              public void onNext(AccessToken accessToken) {
                   // token received, user is now authenticated
                   aferoClient.setToken(accessToken);
                   // we should now call aferoClient.usersMe() to get the account ID
              }

              @Override
              public void onError(Throwable t) {
                   // call failed, log the error
                   AfLog.e(t);
              }

              @Override
              public void onCompleted() {
                  // call completed with no errors
              }
         });

        Parameters:
        user - identifier for the user account - typically an email address
        password - user's password
        Returns:
        Observable that emits an AccessToken in Observer.onNext(T).

      • resetPassword

        public Observable<Void> resetPassword(String email)
        Afero Cloud API call to asynchronously trigger a password reset email to be sent to the specified email address.
        Parameters:
        email - address to which the reset email will be sent
        Returns:
        Observable that initiates the transaction when subscribed

      • usersMe

        public Observable<UserDetails> usersMe()
        Afero Cloud API call to asynchronously fetch the UserDetails which includes the account ID used in setOwnerAndActiveAccountId(String)
        Returns:
        Observable that emits UserDetails in Observer.onNext(T).

      • getDeviceTimeZone

        public Observable<TimeZone> getDeviceTimeZone(DeviceModel deviceModel)
        Afero Cloud API call to fetch the device's TimeZone, if any. If the device has no TimeZone set the Observable will be empty and will simply complete with no error.
        Specified by:
        getDeviceTimeZone in interface AferoClient
        Parameters:
        deviceModel - DeviceModel
        Returns:
        Observable that emits the device TimeZone.
        See Also:
        TimeZone.getTimeZone(java.lang.String)

      • postDeviceInfo

        public Observable<Response<Void>> postDeviceInfo(String userId,
                                                 DeviceInfoBody body)
        Afero Cloud API call that posts the specified DeviceInfoBody for the specified user. The DeviceInfoBody most importantly includes a DeviceInfoBody.pushId for use with push notification services, and a unique DeviceInfoBody.mobileDeviceId generated by the app to identify the specific device on which the app is running.
        Parameters:
        userId - ID of the user returned via usersMe()
        body - DeviceInfoBody to be posted
        Returns:
        Observable that emits an empty Response object in Observer.onNext(T).

      • deleteDeviceInfo

        public Observable<Void> deleteDeviceInfo(String userId,
                                         String mobileDeviceId)
        Afero Cloud API call to remove the DeviceInfoBody for the specified user. Used internally by signOut(java.lang.String, java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        userId - ID of the user returned via usersMe()
        mobileDeviceId - unique device ID generated by the app
        Returns:
        Observable

      • signOut

        public void signOut(String userId,
                    String mobileDeviceId)
        Signs out of the active account by calling deleteDeviceInfo(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) clears the active AccessToken.
        Parameters:
        userId - ID of the user returned via usersMe()
        mobileDeviceId - unique device ID generated by the app

        public void setToken(AccessToken token)
        Sets the active OAuth token
        Parameters:
        token - AccessToken to become active

        Returns:

        Returns:
        ErrorBody containing more details about the error, or null
